apiDocs.title: API Documentation
apiDocs.description: This page provides documentation for both backend and Python service APIs. You can use these APIs to integrate PDF editing capabilities into your own applications.
apiDocs.iframeError: Failed to load API documentation. Your browser may be blocking third-party cookies or content.
apiDocs.openDirectly: If the documentation doesn't load above, you can open it directly in a new tab:

userGuide.title: User Guide
userGuide.introText: PDF Editor is a web application that allows you to manipulate PDF files in various ways. This guide explains how to use the application and its features.
userGuide.introDescription: PDF Editor allows users to easily manipulate PDF files directly in the web browser. You don't need to install any additional software - just log in and start working with your PDF documents.
userGuide.gettingStartedText: To use the PDF Editor, you need to sign in with your account. If you don't have an account, you can register for free.
userGuide.registrationStep1: Click the "Register" button in the top menu
userGuide.registrationStep2: Fill in your email address and password
userGuide.loginStep1: Click the "Login" button in the top menu
userGuide.loginStep2: Enter your email address and password
userGuide.dashboardDescription: After logging in, the dashboard will be displayed where you will see:
userGuide.recentActivityDesc: Recent Activity - list of recently edited files
userGuide.quickAccessDesc: Quick Access - shortcuts to the most used tools
userGuide.apiAccessDesc: API Access - your API key for programmatic access to services

merge.title: Merge PDF
merge.step2: Upload PDF files you want to merge
merge.step3: Arrange files in the desired order by moving them up/down
merge.step5: After completion, download the merged PDF file

split.title: Split PDF
split.step2: Upload the PDF file you want to split
split.step3: Select the split method (by pages, by range, extract specific pages)
split.step4: Enter the desired pages or ranges
split.step6: After completion, download the resulting PDF files or ZIP archive

watermark.title: Add Watermark
watermark.step2: Upload the PDF file you want to add a watermark to
watermark.step4: Adjust watermark parameters (transparency, size, color, angle)
watermark.step5: Select the pages to apply the watermark to
watermark.step7: After completion, download the resulting PDF file

rotate.title: Rotate PDF
rotate.step2: Upload the PDF file you want to rotate
rotate.step4: Select the pages you want to rotate
rotate.step6: After completion, download the resulting PDF file

deletePages.title: Delete Pages
deletePages.step2: Upload the PDF file from which you want to delete pages
deletePages.step3: Select the pages you want to delete
deletePages.step5: After completion, download the resulting PDF file

userGuide.apiUsageText: You can also use our API to integrate PDF editing capabilities into your own applications. See the API Documentation for more details.
userGuide.apiKeyDescription: You can find your personal API key on the dashboard in the "API Access" section. You must include this key in the header of every API request.
userGuide.apiRequestHeader: You must add a header with your API key to every API request:
userGuide.fullApiDocumentation: You can find the complete API documentation in the "API Documentation" section in the main menu.
userGuide.commonIssuesText: This section covers common issues you might encounter while using the PDF Editor and how to resolve them.

fileSizeLimit.question: I cannot upload a file larger than 50 MB
fileSizeLimit.answer: PDF Editor currently has a 50 MB limit for uploaded files. If you need to process larger files, try first splitting them into smaller parts or use a PDF compression tool.

mergeMultipleFiles.question: How can I merge more than 10 PDF files?
mergeMultipleFiles.answer: Even though the interface shows the option to upload a maximum of 10 files at once, you can merge more files gradually. First merge the first 10 files, then use the resulting file and merge it with other files.

passwordProtected.question: My password-protected PDF cannot be processed
passwordProtected.answer: PDF Editor currently does not support processing password-protected PDF files. Before uploading to the application, you must remove the password from the PDF (using the original application in which the PDF was created).

formattingLost.question: Formatting/fonts were lost after merging PDFs
formattingLost.answer: Some PDF files use special fonts that may not be properly embedded in the document. We recommend that you always check the resulting PDF file and, in case of formatting problems, try to save the original files with embedded fonts.

newApiKey.question: How can I create a new API key?
newApiKey.answer: You can generate a new API key on the Dashboard in the "API Access" section. Click the "Generate New Key" button. Please note that after generating a new key, the previous key will be invalid.

cookies.message: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.
cookies.privacyIntro: This Cookie Policy explains how PDF Editor uses cookies and similar technologies to provide, customize, evaluate, improve, promote and protect our services.
cookies.cookiesExplanation: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to the website owners.
cookies.essentialDescription: These cookies are necessary for the website to function properly. They enable basic functions like page navigation and access to secure areas of the website.
cookies.preferencesDescription: These cookies allow the website to remember choices you make (such as your language preference) and provide enhanced, more personal features.
cookies.statisticsDescription: These cookies collect information about how visitors use a website, for instance which pages they visit most often. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous.
cookies.managingDescription: You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not work if you do so. You can also delete cookies that have already been set.

pdf.metadataNote: Note: Metadata editing may not be supported in all PDF viewers.

pdf.tocInfo: The table of contents adds bookmarks that are visible when opening the PDF in a viewer. Each entry links to the corresponding page.

pdf.extractImagesInfo: This tool will extract all embedded images from the PDF file. Image quality depends on how the images were originally embedded in the PDF.

pdf.dropImagesHere: Drop files here or click to browse
pdf.compressionNote: Note: Higher compression may reduce quality.
pdf.ownerPasswordHint: Optional password to restrict permissions (printing, copying, etc.).
